com.madrobot.net.client.websocket

Class WebSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.madrobot.net.client.websocket.WebSocket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndroidWebSocketClient

    public class WebSocket
extends Object
    Provide an implementation of the HTML5 WebSocket class: http://dev.w3.org/html5/websockets/

    Where feasible, we use similar conventions/names here as in the HTML5 spec for familiarity. This class manages a worker thread which actually performs all of the connection management. For simplicity, the several events are collapsed down to a single event handler registration and distinguished with an event code.

    This class implements thewebsocketprotocol-03 http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-hybi-thewebsocketprotocol-03

    Author:
    stella

        public static final int EVENT_MESSAGE
        A message has been received. The message field will be set.

      • EVENT_ERROR

        public static final int EVENT_ERROR
        An error occurred. If this was due to an exception, the event error field will be set. In general, errors cause the io thread to commence shutdown.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • start

        public void start()
        The HTML5 implementation presumably starts after the current tick. This base class has no threading ideas so it has an explicit start() method. If already started does nothing. Otherwise, starts the processing thread. Environment specific subclasses will typically integrate with the native message loop to handle this detail for you.
